text: The first inauguration of Theodore Roosevelt as the 26th president of the United States, took place on September 14, 1901 in Buffalo, New York. It took place after the assassination of President William McKinley. John R. Hazel, U.S. District Judge for the Western District of New York, administered the oath of office. While some people called it an inauguration, others called it a swearing-in ceremony. ==References== Category:1901 in the United States Category:Theodore Roosevelt Roosevelt, Theodore Category:1900s in New York (state) Category:20th century in Buffalo, New York
title: First inauguration of Theodore Roosevelt
